column4: are you using vi?  installing vim would probably be a good idea.  for copy/paste highlighting with mouse, then using mouse 3rd button (typically rollers) to paste
alternative to roller paste, try shift+insert

I'm trying to pipe stdout straight to my clipboard to be retrieve with control-c. xclip stores it so I can retrieve it with mbutton, but not control-c. I could write stdout to a file and copy it with an editor, but that seems roundabout.
sorry, not not familiar with xclip - good luck.
